articles.content:
Campaign for newspaper reform starts in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- The people's action for newspaper reform which groups 156 civic and public organizations in South Korea launched a full-dress campaign for a newspaper reform after holding a ceremony of declaring independence of newspapers in Seoul, Taejon, Kwangju and other areas on April 7, the Seoul-based MBC reported.
 The organization decided to strongly react to biased reports and coercive newspaper reading so as to achieve independence of newspapers and, at the same time, push forward the moves to revise the law on periodicals, create a press development committee of the "national assembly" and improve the system for putting newspaper marketing on a normal footing.    
 That day the participants in the ceremony conducted a ten million signature campaign calling for a newspaper reform and staged a satirical drama before marching on streets.

articles.title: Participants in art festival pay tribute to Kim Il Sung
Palestinian ambassador hosts reception
articles.content:
Participants in art festival pay tribute to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Government cultural delegations and delegates of various countries, foreign guests and artistes and overseas Korean artistes participating in the 19th April Spring Friendship Art Festival yesterday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where President Kim Il Sung lies in state for perpetuity and paid tribute to him.
 The visitors bowed in veneration to the president who looks as in his lifetime before being shown round the mourning hall.    
 They saw the train he used for his on-site guidance and foreign trips and the car used by him in the last period of his life.

articles.content:
Foreign guests visit third Kimilsungia show 
    Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys, military attaches' corps and cultural attaches of foreign embassies here visited the third Kimilsungia show yesterday on the occasion of Sun's Day, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
 The guests looked round Kimilsungias on display, being briefed on them which are in full bloom, carrying the reverence of the world people and Korean people for him.    
 Meanwhile, cultural attaches of foreign embassies here visited the Jonsung Revolutionary Museum.

Kim Jong Il issues order on promoting  military ranks 
    Pyongyang, April 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il issued an order on promoting military ranks of leading officers of the KPA on April 13, Juche 90 (2001).
 The order says he ordered to promote military ranks of leading officers of the KPA on the occasion of Sun's Day, firmly believing that they would as ever firmly guarantee the security of the country and the revolutionary cause of Juche with arms and actively contribute to the efforts to open up the way of building a powerful socialist nation true to the army-first revolutionary leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea as the hard core of the Korean revolutionary armed forces.    
 One leading officer was promoted to colonel general, three leading officers were promoted to lieut. Generals and 15 to maj. generals, according to the order.
